page.title: 03L' Berkhamsted-Historical
page.content: As you approach the village, the well known local landmark,{Stratton's {Folly,}can be seen on the skyline. Built in 1789 by Admiral Stratton ,the brick tower is 100 ft. high,and stands on land 350ft. above sea level.It has 135 steps to the top, and there is a room on each floor.It is now a private residence. There are various stories as to why it was built. One theory is for astronomical purposes, another is that it was to enable him to see ships coming up the Thames! Another interesting building is the {Manor House.}It has always been a private residence, and was once owned by the famous circus owner, Bertram Mills. The present owner showed us records of rent paid back in the 17th century.
